WorkItem.Description:
When I try to include a '£' character inside a string literal in Typescript I get a "Cannot read file" ...... "Unsupported Character Error" from the Typescript Compiler in VS2012 Pro. I'm running with Typescript V 0.9.11.
If I replace the offending character with '\u00A3' the compiler is happy.
WorkItem.Summary: Error thrown when I use '£' in a string.

Comments.Message:
Ensure your file is saved with UTF-8, not ANSI or any other encoding.  The above error occurs if the file is an unsupported encoding.

If your files are saved with UTF-8 (or UTF-16), we support any Unicode characters the ECMAScript 5 supports.
